perturbation.original_text: 4.2.1 You shall pay to us a royalty fee based on revenue generated by Unit Franchisees (the "Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee") equal to twenty-five percent (25%) of aggregate royalty fees paid to you by Unit Franchisees in the Master Territory pursuant to their Unit Franchise Agreements. The Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee shall be paid by you to us in the manner provided in Section 4.3 of this Agreement by the fifteenth(15 th ) day of each calendar month based on royalty fees generated and received during the previous calendar month.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2.1 You shall pay to us a royalty fee based on revenue generated by Unit Franchisees (the "Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee") equal to twenty-five percent (25%) of aggregate royalty fees paid to you by Unit Franchisees in the Master Territory pursuant to their Unit Franchise Agreements. The Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee shall be paid by you to us in the manner provided in Section 4.3 of this Agreement by the thirtieth (30th) day of each calendar month based on royalty fees generated and received during the previous calendar month.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that the Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee should be paid by the thirtieth (30th) day of each calendar month, while other sections may still refer to the fifteenth (15th) day, leading to confusion about the actual payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: 4.4 Interest on Overdue Amounts Any payment not actually received by us on or before the Fifteen (15 th ) day of each month (or the next business day if the Fifteen(15 th ) of any month is not a business day) shall be deemed overdue and you shall pay to us, in addition to the overdue payment, interest on such overdue amount at the rate of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less. Interest shall accrue from the original due date until payment is received in full. Our right to such interest shall be in addition to any other remedies we may have, including, without limitation, the right of set-off to withdraw or retain, from time to time and without notice to you, any amounts due and unpaid by us to you. You shall not be entitled to set-off any payments required to be made under this Section 4 against any monetary claim you may have against us.

Interest shall accrue from the original due date until payment is received in full. perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that the franchisee *is* entitled to set-off any payments required to be made under this Section 4 against any monetary claim they may have against the franchisor. The original text said that the franchisee *is not* entitled to this. Because these statements are in the same section, they contradict each other and create an ambiguity in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: 11.4.2 In addition to the foregoing, upon termination of this Agreement by us for cause as described in Section 10, you agree to pay to us within fifteen (15) days after the effective date of this Agreement's termination, in addition to the amounts owed hereunder, liquidated damages equal to the average monthly Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee and Franchise Sales Royalty Fee you paid during the twelve (12) months of operation preceding the effective date of termination multiplied by (a) twenty-four (24) (being the number of months in two (2) full years), or (b) the number of months remaining in the Agreement had it not been terminated, whichever is lower.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.4.2 In addition to the foregoing, upon termination of this Agreement by us for cause as described in Section 10, you agree to pay to us within thirty (30) days after the effective date of this Agreement's termination, in addition to the amounts owed hereunder, liquidated damages equal to the average monthly Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee and Franchise Sales Royalty Fee you paid during the twelve (12) months of operation preceding the effective date of termination multiplied by (a) twenty-four (24) (being the number of months in two (2) full years), or (b) the number of months remaining in the Agreement had it not been terminated, whichever is lower.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by modifying the payment deadline for liquidated damages from fifteen (15) days to thirty (30) days after the termination date. This conflicts with potential references to the original fifteen (15) day deadline elsewhere in the contract, creating uncertainty about the correct deadline for this payment.
